newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela privatization has only 50-50 chance - poll.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela privatization has only 50-50 chance - poll.

text.p: Venezuela's private sector gives the government's privatization program only a 50-50 chance of success, with political interests the most likely cause of failure, a business survey showed Thursday.

"There's a general feeling that the regulatory framework is weak, especially in the electrical sector ... and of a very slow political process," Pedro Carmona, the president of local business chamber Coindustria told reporters. Coindustria conducted the survey.
Eighty-seven percent of respondents also said they believed privatization would benefit the country, even as 55 percent said they would not participate in the sales.
National business confidence is nevertheless on the rise, according to Coindustria's first quarter country-wide survey of 450 small, medium and large businesses.
On a scale of one to six, with six the highest measure of bullish sentiment, the survey's general index rose to 3.94.
"But when asked to look ahead over the next twelve months, the confidence index rises to 4.4 ... with the only qualms concern over the consistency of government policies," Carmona said.
Carmona warned that a strenthening bolivar, so far used successfully to beat down inflation, was high on the list of future worries.
"We calculate the bolivar is now around 10 percent over- valued, a tolerable level ... but it could more than double that by the end of the year," he added.
